result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher C Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christopher C Miller is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christopher C Miller was found guilty of Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentencing being served

miscConds.notes: Submit to DNA sample. Surcharge waived

Court costs waived by the court.
 If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

State indicates victim rights have been complied with. Court examines defendant, accepts change of plea and finds defendant guilty. Court renders sentence.

Defendant Christopher C Miller in court with attorney Sergio Magana.  Defendant in custody of Ozaukee Co Jail. Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Dlapa sworn and testified. Status hearing on April 8, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

State by ADA Jeffrey Sisley.  Defendant in custody & appearing by video conferencing from the Ozaukee County Jail and with Atty Dejunco.  Counsel advises the defendant does qualify for representation and counsel will be appointed out.  Counsel waives reading & advises the defendant is serving a sentence until May this year and then awaiting sent after revocation on another matter.  Court finds probable cause.  State requesting $5000 cash bail.  No bail argument by counsel.  Cousnel requesting status of prelim hrg; waiving timelimits.  Court orders $500 cash bail. Court orders matter adj to 4/8 at 8:15 am for status of prelim hrg.
